Computer Graphics Programming Assignment
  • Question Eighteen

Question Eighteen

Write a program to generate the locations of pixels along a rasterized line segment using Bresenham’s algorithm. Check that your program works for all slopes and all possible locations of the endpoints. What is the initial value of the decision variable?

BresenhamLine Class

class BresenhamLine

A class for generating pixel locations along a rasterized line segment using Bresenham’s Line Drawing Algorithm.

Variables:

  • start (tuple) – (x, y) coordinates of the starting point.

  • end (tuple) – (x, y) coordinates of the ending point.

  • points (list) – List of pixel locations along the line.

__init__(start, end)

Initialize the BresenhamLine object.

Parameters:

  • start (tuple) – (x, y) coordinates of the starting point.

  • end (tuple) – (x, y) coordinates of the ending point.

draw_line()

Generate the locations of pixels along the rasterized line segment using Bresenham’s algorithm.

create_image(filename='line_image.png')

Create an image and draw the line on it.

Parameters:

filename (str) – Name of the output image file (default is ‘line_image.png’).

Example usage:

if __name__ == "__main__":
    # Example usage
    start_point = (10, 20)
    end_point = (100, 80)

    bresenham_line = BresenhamLine(start_point, end_point)
    bresenham_line.draw_line()
    bresenham_line.create_image('output_line.png')
